Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    Deck object that holds an ArrayList of Card objects.
    Author:
    StevenCasey

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Deck()
      Standard constructor that creates a standard deck of 52 Card objects with appropriate rank and suit.
      Deck(java.util.ArrayList<Card> newDeck)
      Alt Constructor that takes an ArrayList of cards directly and sets the new Deck's list to the input list.
      Deck(Deck aDeck)
      Alt Constructor that takes a deck and sets new Deck's stack of cards to the input Deck's stack.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToDeck(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardArray)
      Appends an ArrayList of Card objects to current Deck's cards.
      void addToDeck(Card aCard)
      Alt method that takes a singular Card object and adds it to the current Deck's stack.
      int deckSize() 
      java.util.ArrayList<Card> getCards() 
      int numCards() 
      Card pullCard()
      Pulls a card from the deck and returns it.
      void setDeck(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardArray)
      Sets Deck's ArrayList of cards to an input ArrayList and also adjusts deckSize var.
      void shuffle(java.util.ArrayList<Card> stackCards)
      Shuffles the input ArrayList of Card objects using rand() to go through and swap each index with a random other index.
      Deck splitDeck()
      Splits the Deck into two ArrayLists of Card objects.
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deck

        public Deck()
        Standard constructor that creates a standard deck of 52 Card objects with appropriate rank and suit. Also holds the deckSize as an int.

      • Deck

        public Deck(Deck aDeck)
        Alt Constructor that takes a deck and sets new Deck's stack of cards to the input Deck's stack.
        Parameters:
        aDeck - Deck object containing a ArrayList of cards

      • Deck

        public Deck(java.util.ArrayList<Card> newDeck)
        Alt Constructor that takes an ArrayList of cards directly and sets the new Deck's list to the input list.
        Parameters:
        newDeck - ArrayList of Card objects

    • Method Detail

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle(java.util.ArrayList<Card> stackCards)
        Shuffles the input ArrayList of Card objects using rand() to go through and swap each index with a random other index.
        Parameters:
        stackCards - ArrayList of card objects to be shuffled

      • pullCard

        public Card pullCard()
        Pulls a card from the deck and returns it. Also deletes the card from the deck and reassigns deckSize approprietly.
        Returns:
        Card object from the Deck's ArrayList

      • splitDeck

        public Deck splitDeck()
        Splits the Deck into two ArrayLists of Card objects. Returns one half and leaves the other for the current Deck's ArrayList.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Card Objects that equals half of the original Deck's

      • deckSize

        public int deckSize()

      • getCards

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> getCards()

      • setDeck

        public void setDeck(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardArray)
        Sets Deck's ArrayList of cards to an input ArrayList and also adjusts deckSize var.
        Parameters:
        cardArray - ArrayList of Card objects

      • addToDeck

        public void addToDeck(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cardArray)
        Appends an ArrayList of Card objects to current Deck's cards.
        Parameters:
        cardArray - ArrayList of Card Objects

      • addToDeck

        public void addToDeck(Card aCard)
        Alt method that takes a singular Card object and adds it to the current Deck's stack.
        Parameters:
        aCard - Card Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • numCards

        public int numCards()
